attributes.action: Pupils in UK to get Centre Assessed Grades
attributes.additional_details: Gavin Williamson promised that pupils would get the grades that they deserved.  How can this be the case if the grades are going to be based on the 2019/18 cohorts at their schools.  Scottish pupils have had their grades reissued as a result of this unfair system.  Pupils in England, Wales and N.Ireland should be treated the same, particularly as they will be competing against them for further and higher education places as well as jobs in the future.
attributes.background: The Scottish Parliament made sure that pupils got the teacher estimates that their schools worked hard to give them. The Pupils in the UK should be ensured the same thing.  Pupils should receive the grades that their schools gave them, not a standardised score based on a schools prior attainment.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions instead:

Review the decision to use previous data to calculate exam grades: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/306773

Review the standardisation of grades so state school pupils aren't disadvantaged: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325422

Remove Ofqual's moderation of 2020 results based on schools previous performance: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/328957

Reverse all exam grades back to teacher’s own predictions: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/334491

Work with regulators and exam providers to clarify exam arrangements for 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/312570
